item.title: SHAP visualization for XGBoost in R: SHAPforxgboost
item.description: SHAP package in R Why SHAP values Local Explanation Consistency in Global Feature Importance SHAP plots Summary plot Alternatives ways to make the same plot: Dependence plot Interaction effects SHAP force plot References SHAP package in R The R plotting functions used in this blog illustrates the R package **SHAPforxgboost". Please install from github. devtools::install_github("liuyanguu/SHAPforxgboost") Why SHAP values SHAPâ€™s main advantages are local explanation and consistency in global model structure.

item.title: SHAP Visualization in R (first post)
item.description: Background Example 1 SHAP summary plot Alternative ways: SHAP dependence plot SHAP interaction effect plot SHAP force plot Example 2 Summary plot Dependence plot for each feature Force plot Stack plot by clustering groups Update 19/07/21: The R Package SHAPforxgboost has been released, An updated version of these functions has been posted in a later post. I used a package to wrap them up. Please refer to: SHAP visualization for XGBoost in R
